title: What are the best or most innovative HR Tech companies you've come across? - Quora

response.answer_text: I work for WalkMe, a digital adoption platform that helps with a lot of issues that HR departments deal with. WalkMe is a layer that’s deployed over almost any platform/website/software and let you guide users to quick task completion. It lets you speed up the training process for new employees on the platform’s the platforms they’ll have to use in their position. It can also show you where employees get stuck and fix that, you can use the platform to push company wide messages, to quickly finish yearly/monthly reports and so much more. You can read more about it here: How Contextual Learning is Revolutionizing Employee Training

Self-nominating a bit here: CareerBlitz CareerBlitz turns past applicants into future hires. Each week, you get candidates delivered to your inbox with context about why they were chosen, and pre-written, personalized messages for each. Then you click a button and we automate all the outreach and follow-ups.  On average, teams are hitting 40% reply rates from their outbound messages on CareerBlitz — usually, about 50% of those are positive replies. And >60% of teams set interviews in their first week on the platform. CareerBlitz is SaaS platform that heavily works with fast growing, tech employers. Happy to discuss more and provide more info!
